posts.post_content: I agree with comments. I’m not angry at the 2/3 P/T but definitely feel it would make things just a bit more feisty as a 1/4. Then again, if it’s worth trying to get a 4 casting cost creature on the board with this much effect, we’d probably be prepared to have him protected in some kind of way or another. Once again, its effects are juicy for lockdown. 4 stars if you’re specifically working the card into your theme, could also be on that soldier army and have reduced casting cost, but overall 3 ½ stars, especially if you’re generally trying to fit it in because of its cool effects. Another way to think about it is like this: would you draft it if it came your way? If I was drafting white I would have no worries taking this card. Now if I wasn’t drafting white, might I still take this card if I felt I didn’t have enough options to not get screwed by it in play? Like you guys say, at 3 toughness this card doesn’t strike that automatic fear in an opponent. Could end up just a mo... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Gahoojin (4/17/2011 11:45:19 AM)

posts.post_content:
Card of the Day, February 5, 2013,  
[Kismet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kismet) on a stick here is third best anthropomorphic elephant in Magic, I'd say. Right after [Loxodon Hierarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Loxodon Hierarch) at #1 and [Loxodon Smiter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Loxodon Smiter) at #2. But according to today's arcana these guys are no longer keeping the gates, so the gates "got all crashed." And I choose not to believe the fact that the flavor text is a fart joke.
posts.html:
Card of the Day, February 5, 2013,
Kismet on a stick here is third best anthropomorphic elephant in Magic, I'd say. Right after Loxodon Hierarch at #1 and Loxodon Smiter at #2. But according to today's arcana these guys are no longer keeping the gates, so the gates "got all crashed." And I choose not to believe the fact that the flavor text is a fart joke.
